skill.name: test-generator
skill.description: Generate comprehensive test boilerplate following project TDD conventions. Use when creating new tests for modules, classes, or functions. Automatically creates tests with proper structure, type hints, docstrings, and AAA pattern.

skill.author: Atyantik

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and Jinja2-style templates for pytest test generation. No executable scripts, network access, filesystem operations, or external commands are present. The skill cannot execute code, access user files, or modify system state.

content.value_statement: Writing tests from scratch takes time and requires following project conventions. This skill automatically generates comprehensive test templates with proper AAA pattern, type hints, and parametrized test cases tailored to your project standards.
actual_capabilities: Generate test files for functions, classes, and modules
Create parametrized test cases with multiple input combinations
Build async test templates with pytest-asyncio markers
Produce pytest fixture templates with proper setup and teardown
Apply AAA pattern and type hints following project conventions
limitations: Does not execute or run tests directly
Templates require user customization for actual test data
Requires project documentation to be present for full context
Only generates templates, not full implementation

output_examples.input: generate tests for src/utils.py - function format_name(first: str, last: str) -> str
output: Test cases: basic, valid input, invalid input, edge cases
All tests follow AAA pattern with type hints
Review TODO comments and add actual test data

best_practices: Always run generated tests immediately to confirm they fail (TDD red phase)
Replace all TODO comments with actual test data before implementation
Use parametrized tests for multiple input combinations to maximize coverage
Add edge case tests for empty values, None, and boundary conditions
anti_patterns: Avoid mocking internal functions or validators - use real code where possible
Do not write tests that test multiple unrelated behaviors in one function
Avoid over-mocking: only mock HTTP, database, file I/O, time, and random values

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: The skill generates tests compatible with Python 3.9+ using modern type hints and annotations.

faq.question: What testing frameworks work with the templates?
faq.answer: Templates are designed for pytest, pytest-asyncio for async tests, and compatible with pytest-cov for coverage.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing test suites?
faq.answer: Templates follow standard pytest conventions and can be added to any tests/ directory structure.

faq.question: Is any data stored or sent externally?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill with no network access, file writes, or external data transmission.

faq.question: Why do generated tests fail initially?
faq.answer: Tests follow TDD methodology. They fail until you implement the actual code being tested. This is expected behavior.

faq.question: How does this compare to other test generators?
faq.answer: Unlike AI-generated tests, these templates follow strict project conventions with AAA pattern, type hints, and docstrings.
